You weren't perma-banned for this chat. You were perma-banned because you are continuing down the path that you were consistently warned about.

Prior to this penalty, you have had:
2x 10-game chat restrictions
2x 25-game chat restrictions
2x 14-day bans
1x manual time ban based upon manual account review

> Riot please get a grip on your tribunal.......

If anything, I'd say the system didn't catch you fast enough.

>The real world allows you to speak your mind, but in Riots world words like terrible, pathetic, and bad gets you permabanned.

You are allowed to speak your mind in the real world, but just like here the real world also has consequences for what you say. You can very easily be kicked out of a restaurant, bar, or any other business for insulting and verbally harassing others, be it employees or other customers, In fact, you can even be fired doing this, all just for "speaking your mind." Also, continually doing this even after numerous warnings can result in you not being allowed in that place of business again. That's pretty much what's happening here. You were given multiple warnings that your behavior was not acceptable, yet you continued with it anyway. The reason for your permanent ban wasn't because you were calling others terrible, pathetic, bad, useless, etc., it was because you continually did so even after multiple warnings saying that unacceptable to do this. You essentially showed Riot that you had no intention of changing your behavior, so Riot permanently banned the account.
https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/free_speech.png

"im done with ganking "

technically speaking, the community is the one making up the rules. As the system learns from what the community deems as reportable. 

so if majority of the community thinks that it is offensive, then offensive it is. 

example: if "mickey mouse" was a term that caught on and is being said in every other game, and every game it was said, someone reported it. Which means "Mickey Mouse" has a 100% reported rate (keep in mind this is over millions of games per hour) and is deemed toxic and will get you a punishment if you said "mickey mouse" too often.

By the above example, "Mickey Mouse" has nothing to do with the TOS, but yet people will still get punished for it.
